comments.body: great idea if you have more than 2 players in the same world!
YES
Yes. I don't like trying to label who's who with the colors every time I play multiplayer.
Nicee brooo . Nice idea player head instead of dot would be great
PLEASE
Agreed! The Ghastling is so cute and it would be great to keep it as a pet and only evolve it by player choice.
I think overall there should be a way to stop baby mobs from growing, snifflets deserve this too (perhaps a new use for clocks)

Considering how easy it is to get snowballs, i'd be happy if they were mandatory for getting a happy ghast. That way we could have our little floating buddies forever, seperate to our big floating buddies
Strongly agree! I wanna keep my cute baby ghasts.
While the ghastling is cute, I think I would want it to eventually grow up because otherwise I don't really have a use for it. (Besides, the happy ghast is cute in its own way).
I agree, this would add a bit more control to the game.
i don't agree with you.
Makes sense! because it is small and then somehow turns big! must turn into teenager ghast and the happy ghast i guess?

Fireball = ghast
Snowball = happy ghast
Slimeball = flying slime
Nothing = ghastling x
Would it be cool
thats not a good idea . why sould we even turn dried ghast to ghastling . ghastling is useless
at first I thought this was a bad idea until I heard if I fed it it would work
I also agree. Ghastlings are really cute! It would be great to keep them. Or even maybe fly on them, but only one player and they would be easier to steer and they would fit in smaller spaces.
one on hand, i like it, but also not sure

I would absolutely love something like this, and the idea to perhaps use them as tight ropes in some regard at a speed penalty would make parkour all the more exciting; especially if by jumping on them they can offer a higher jump.
Lead mechanics to chains for the same purpose.
This is such a cool idea but along with the rope fence. Along with it, could you add in some different styled fences and gates?

I think there should be a different type of fences which don't automatically connect to each other but could be connected by other means like using the leashes. The gap between two fences with one block between is huge. It can be made tightier using debug stick to remove connections but for example when a door opens nearby, the fences connect again. This would allow players to choose which fences they want to be connected.
i tried doing that when i hit my copper golem XD
The Copper Golem should also have its texture be more cracked the less health it has.
I think it make sense to add it. Unlike snow golems they are also made out of hard materials like iron golems, how is this not in the game yet. I'm confused, Mojang.
Chicken jockeys must drop corn so you can make popcorn
But, in Java, they are very slow now.
That would be hilarious
Why not? :3
Missed opportunity
And then you could get the lava chicken music discs without having to search for chicken jockeys elsewhere.
I think it should be as fast as sprint jumping when sprinting, because it can fly already.
Yes, in sprint mode It should be also a bit faster than sprint jumping in my opinion, it's would be a good in-between progression step in movement speeds before obtaining the Elytra.
they are to slooow
They are annoyingly slow

I don't understand why every other mode of transport doesn't have an equivalent of Fireworks. If Elytras never had fireworks, then every other mode of transport would at least be comparable, but with the addition of fireworks elytras are just WAY too good for anything else to be worth using in ANY stage of Minecraft. I'm not saying remove fireworks though. They just need to increase the base speed of everything OR design a comparable speed boost for other modes of transport as Elytras have with fire works levels 1,2, and 3.
idea is good but it would kinda stray far from the vanilla feel
I think this would be a great idea! Finally, the happy ghast would have a soul purpose in earlier game.
I like that idea because then like blazes and breezes they could add a new water one or something
lol just put trial chambers in the sky, that's where the Breeze should be anyway.
Oh definitely, now that the build limit is higher and we have the ghast with elytra - a special sky biome would be AMAZING
Overworld sky biome has been my biggest dream in Minecraft , and would be perfect place for new enemies, just add some good loot to make it worth
It would be cool if they made the islands over the void and had cliffs to bedrock when it switched biomes.
i second this. it'd also help in getting the ghasts attention. it has a habit of flying away from u

I mean the whole reason behind snowballs being their choice of food for the happy ghast was because the original ghasts had fireballs, so it's the opposite. When you hit a fireball back at the ghast, it damages it, so when you throw a snowball at a happy ghast, it should heal it
I agree! This would also allow for the automation of healing though dispensers.
I agree! It could even open its mouth and eyes to "eat" it like the Nether ghast does when it shoots a fireball.

Witch village in the pale oak, they live in treehouses and eat creamy pumpkinsoup made from new white pumpkins. You need to get a witches hat in order to go in and trade with them or they will be hostile.

Cherry village will add new paperblocks to the game and paperdoors. They will have ricefields for food and lots of chickens as well as ducks. They will decorate with lanterns made from paper.

 

How about this?

Even though having more villages would be cool, interesting and etc.
The pale garden is way too rare to make a village in there and cherry blossoms are too small for villages.
Or, add Jungle Villages and Swamp Villages to the Jungle Edge and Swamp biomes respectively.
I would like to see a seaside village added.

the badlands is lacking in every way, it need a western village, lots of gold loot in chests, instead of abandoned mine shafts it should have active ones with a new villager job, the "miner" who sells and trades for ores, make pigs and horses the only cattle in these villages which can add to the gold and piglin game lore... I really want there to be larger village houses because the small ones aren't practical. There should also be large wheat fields.

The Chery Grove village should be a japanese village. It would actually be better to combine the jungle and cherry grove biome to create a new biome, and put a village in that. This village would also have rice fields. Rice could be used to make sushi which would be a good source of food.

I would actually love to see this... even if it is just the advancements regarded as "Challenges," like "Return to Sender", "How Did We Get Here?" etc.. that would be awesome.. kinda like the character creator items in Bedrock Edition. I mean... although that sort of thing is something that you'd see more of in a strictly online game, where your achievements are linked to a single character, rather than a world.. still though capes for advancements/challenges: Epic idea.

That‚Äôs a amazing idea because you can only get the pan-cape for free, Also it should only be for the harder achievements.
This is a good idea!

In addition to getting skin items and achievements, you could earn capes. You could unlock a leather cape if you put on leather boots for example. Also, players who make suggestions and get their posts into the game will earn a specially made cape just for them.

As mobs that are effected by lighting normally under go a permeant change. I'd suggest that the speed boost last forever with a visual change to show that its now an "Overcharged" Golem. Such as a lit up antenna or an all over particle effect (like a charged Creeper).
This could also be better if the Copper Golem got unoxidized when struck, like regular copper.

I love the idea of a suoercharged golem, it can be optional too so if there are players who prefer slow golems they can have slow golems, the same with the ones who wants fast golems just using lightning.

It would be cool if this could be combined with the copper golems eyes somehow, maybe that the eyes are off by default, but they turn on when struck with lightning. Would also be cool to have statues with the eyes on

I think it makes sense for players to drop their heads when killed by a lightning-charged creeper.

I think the way of getting player's heads would to do by under this following:

1. An enchantment on weapon(axe only) called Charged Beheading, simulating a charged creeper effect while aiming for player's head, no where else.

2. It only effects with high chance 50% on hard mode (not hardcore). Other difficulty modes has less to effect except hardcore since hardcore is 100%. Normal - 15%, Easy - 5% (Not because Easy mode should always be easy, it'd be less awarding and too cheap aka cheating at higher chance.)

3. With this it can be for collection or tradable for a rare wandering trader called Wandering Charged Trader. The Charged Trader would have a aura around this trader like a charged creeper would, and it'd be very awarding depending on how many heads you have for better awards.

that really will looks good

Agreed. Requiring a saddle in the crafting recipe would give players an additional reason to fight a raid or go fishing! It will also bring it in line with other forms of animal transportation like pigs, horses and the lava thingy I can't seem to remember the name of.
1. I like it. It gives them a use beyond early game.
And why not add a ghast tear (or soul sand) on the recipe. It does not make sense that you can craft a saddle for a nether creature only with overworld materials
I have so many extra saddles from fishing, and you can craft saddles easily now. Putting it in this recipe sounds good.

as someone who often uses a mix of chests and barrels in my storage areas for the aesthetic. I think I'd want Copper Golems to be able to interact with them too. But for similar reasons I'd say not Pots. The Copper Golems possibly filling my decorative columns with odds & ends would be inconvenient.
I 100% agree
I would love if the Copper Golem could fill Barrels too, as I like to use Barrels rather than Chests in my cellars for the aesthetic.

i need this so bad, i use barrels for aesthetic reasons and have made a whole sorting system using barrels but for non stackable items i have to use chests just to sort specific items with the copper golem? it throws off the look of everything i built i hate it. please minecraft make barrels interactable with golems

What if there was a way you could control what storage the golems use? Like if you could craft any storage block with a copper ingot to make a ‚Äúcopper activated {storage}‚Äù. Would look and act the same as the normal block but copper golems would use it. I know Mojang probably made it the way it is right now to try to make them less op, but one of my friends is having to put ugly blockages all over to prevent them from doing dumb things like filling the output of his hopper fed furnace with random junk.
No, it would allow to carry unlimited players since you can leash more than one boat. Honestly I think this change would be op so it is good as it is.

while someone already brought up the infinite capacity exploit, one could argue that introducing a "weight" mechanic would let us have our cake and eat it too; in which there could only be so many players (maybe mobs as well) that can be carried by a ghast before it becomes overburdened, maybe could give the ghast sweat drop graphics to show it's at its limit.
Also I don't think it has many multiplayer possibilities considering how slow it is. Please Mojang change it.

Unfortunately, i think it's kinda impossible since when you ride a boat you are controlling that entity but the entity is controlled also by the happy ghast so it's the only logical solutions that the boat un-leash and fall

I think having slight buff in regeneration + java saturation system where food quality determines the regen speed. Also, please dont make instant regen speed like java, it will ruin my fun in bedrock
Yes! And mangos that grow on jungle trees or a new type of tree in the jungle.

That's a LOT for one drop and requires a lot of research too. 4 trees, each with full woodsets, loads of item models, 6 crops with 3-4 growth stages each. Clamors for alcohol that will likely be in jest but will be over-done. 

This being said, I really love it. The cozy farmer players haven't gotten much love lately. Most of them are on Farmer's Delight and Let's Do series, left behind in 1.20. A broader farming update should be implemented before a fruit one to require players to interact with this mechanic. 

A farming update should have:

  • a scarecrow, a redstone block (happy Redstoners) 
  • crows, which steal food and trinkets but can be killed for shinies like iron or gold nuggets and rarely an ender pearl. (happy Speedrunners) 
  • an oven, placeable bread and pumpkin pie, cookie jar, (happy builders)
  • "Comfort" and "Nutrition" effects that come from more complicated meals (happy players in general) 

I think the last point will be the most important because it will encourage the most interaction with the system.
im here for the dragon fruits

YES!
